motion_model.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 import random
2 import math
3 from amr_localization.pose import Pose
4 
5 # This class represents a motion model for omnidirectional robot and could be
6 # used to sample the possible pose given the starting pose and the commanded
7 # robot's motion.
8 #
9 # The two parameters of the class is standard deviations of translational and
10 # rotational components of the motion.
11 #
12 # The motion is decomposed into two translations along the x axis of the
13 # robot (forward), and along the y axis of the robot (lateral), and one
14 # rotation.
15 #
16 # Usage:
17 #
18 # @code
19 # // Create motion model with 0.02 and 0.01 stddev
20 # motion_model = MotionModel(0.02, 0.01);
21 # // Set the commanded robot's motion
22 # motion_model.setMotion(0.5, 0.1, 0.1);
23 # // Sample the possible pose given the starting pose
24 # // Note that it could be repeated multiple times for the same starting
25 # // pose of for different starting poses
26 # new_pose = motion_model.sample(pose);
27 # @code
28 
29 class MotionModel:
30  def __init__(self, sigma_translation, sigma_rotation):
31  self.forward = 0
32  self.lateral = 0
33  self.rotation = 0
34  self.sigtran = sigma_translation
35  self.sigrot = sigma_rotation
36 
37  def setMotion(self, forward, lateral, rotation):
38  self.forward = forward
39  self.lateral = lateral
40  self.rotation = rotation
41 
42  def sample(self, pose):
43  """
44  Sample a possible pose resulting from the commanded robot's motion, if
45  the robot was in given pose.
46  """
47 
48  """
49  ============================== YOUR CODE HERE ============================
50  Instructions: given the starting pose, compute the new pose according to
51  the motion model. Note that both input and output pose are
52  in world coordinate frame, but the motion parameters are
53  in robot's reference frame.
54 
55  Hint: there are two member fields that represent translational and
56  rotational error distributions. For example, to get a random
57  translational error use:
58 
59  error = random.gauss(0, self.sigtran)
60 
61  ==========================================================================
62  """
63  if self.rotation != 0.0:
64  pose.theta += random.gauss(self.rotation, self.sigrot)
65  if self.forward != 0.0 and self.lateral != 0.0:
66  #tranforming the motion model to global frame and updating it.
67  pose.x =pose.x+ (random.gauss(self.forward, self.sigtran))*math.cos(pose.theta) - (random.gauss(self.lateral, self.sigtran))*math.sin(pose.theta)
68  pose.y =pose.y+(random.gauss(self.forward, self.sigtran))*math.sin(pose.theta) + (random.gauss(self.lateral, self.sigtran))*math.cos(pose.theta)
69 
70 
71  return pose
